IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
DUI: 23-008

This stop was audibly and visually recorded on an Axon MVR system.

PROBABLE CAUSE: 
     On February 11, 2023 at approximately 0227 hours, I was traveling northbound on Garrett Highway, south of Interstate 68, in un-marked MSP unit W-16, in Garrett County, Maryland. I observed a dark colored Dodge pick-up traveling southbound on Garrett Highway at Interstate 68, which had an inoperable driver side headlight. I performed a U-turn and began travelling southbound on Garrett Highway to catch up to the truck. As I caught up to the truck, I observed it travel onto the shoulder of southbound Garrett Highway by one (1) vehicle width. The truck then entered back into the southbound lane of Garrett highway. As I continued to follow the truck, I observed it travel onto the solid double yellow line by one (1) tire width. Shortly after, the truck travelled onto the southbound shoulder of Garrett Highway by three fourths (3/4) of the vehicle’s width, returned to the southbound lane, and then travelled back onto the southbound shoulder by one half (1/2) of the vehicle’s width. I activated my emergency equipment to conduct a traffic stop on the vehicle. The vehicle stopped on the right shoulder of southbound Garrett Highway north of Rabbit Hollow Road and I identified the vehicle as a maroon 1996 Dodge Ram 2500 bearing Maryland registration 35480FT.

INITIAL CONTACT: 
     I approached the passenger side of the Dodge and made contact with the driver, identified by his Maryland Driver’s license as Oscar Henry Johnson Jr. (DOB 8/8/1966). While speaking with Johnson, I observed his eyes displayed a glassy red appearance and his speech was slurred. I asked Johnson how much he had to drink and he advised he had “a couple of beers.” I then asked Johnson to exit the vehicle. While speaking with Johnson outside of his vehicle, I detected a moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from his breath. Johnson voluntarily submitted to standardized field sobriety testing. I explained and demonstrated each test to Johnson. Johnson was asked if he understood each test prior to performing the tests and he replied, “Yes.” Johnson was then asked if he had any medical conditions that would prohibit him from completing the tests. Johnson advised he had no medical conditions that would prohibit him from completing the tests. Johnson was wearing sneakers. I asked Johnson if he was comfortable performing the Standardized Field Sobriety Testing while wearing the sneakers. Johnson elected to perform the Walk and Turn and the One Leg Stand while wearing the sneakers. The Standardized Field Sobriety Tests were performed on the shoulder of Garrett Highway lit by my flashlight. The area was flat and clear of any road debris. 

STANDARDIZED FIELD SOBRIETY TESTING: 

HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS: 
     A pen was utilized as the stimulus for the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus. I checked for equal tracking and normal pupil size. Johnson’s eyes were red and glassy. Johnson’s eyes displayed lack of smooth pursuit, distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation, and onset of nystagmus prior to forty-five degrees in both his right and left eyes. Johnson’s eyes displayed vertical nystagmus in both his right and left eyes. I had to remind Johnson to keep his head still and follow my pen with his eyes. Total clues 6/6

WALK AND TURN: 
     An imaginary line was used as the designated line for the Walk and Turn. I instructed Johnson to place his left foot on the line and then place his right foot heel to toe in front of his left foot while keeping his hands straight down to his sides. I had to tell Johnson to get in the instructed position multiple times before he did so. I instructed Johnson that he was not to move from this position until instructed to do so and he stated that he understood. Johnson lost balance and separated his feet, moving from the instructed position during the instructional phase of the Walk and Turn. Johnson then started the Walk And Turn before being instructed to do so. Johnson stepped off line and missed heel to toe leaving a space greater than one half (½) of an inch between his feet on step five (5) during the first nine (9) steps of the Walk And Turn. Johnson completed the first nine (9) steps, completed the turn, and stumbled almost falling over. Johnson then stopped walking, pointed to his right foot, and asked if that was his next step. Johnson took ten (10) steps during the second nine (9) steps of the Walk And Turn. Johnson had his hands raised greater than six (6) inches from his side during the Walk And Turn. After completing the Walk And Turn, Johnson stated “This ain’t gonna work out.” Total Clues 7/8

ONE LEG STAND: 
     Johnson lifted his left foot for the One Leg Stand. Johnson swayed during the entire One Leg Stand. Johnson put his foot down at six (6) seconds. I advised Johnson to pick his foot up and continue. Johnson asked if he should start at the same number he last counted.  Johnson picked his foot up at twenty (20) seconds and continued the One Leg Stand. Johnson lost balance again and put his foot down at thirty (30) seconds.  Johnson raised his hands greater than six (6) inches from his side during the One Leg Stand. Total clues 3/4 
 
     Due to the observations made, Johnson was placed under arrest for DUI/DWI at 0244 hours. 

     Johnson was read the DR-15 Advice of Rights form out loud at 0315 hours, and refused to submit to the breath test. Johnson’s Maryland driver's license was confiscated and mailed to the MVA. While I was completing the DR-15A form (Control No: AJV06663), Johnson asked how long the MVA would keep his driver’s license. I advised Johnson I was not sure, however the DR-15 advised the suspension for refusing the breath test shall be two-hundred and seventy (270) days. Johnson then advised he did not want to take the test because he knew he would have “flunked.” Johnson then stated “I knew I would have flunked” referring to the breath test. The appropriate charges were completed and Johnson was transported to 170 Brobst Road, Accident, Maryland 21520 where he was released.

TRAINING/CERTIFICATION: 
     I am certified through the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) in Standardized Field Sobriety Testing, received at the Maryland State Police Academy. 

WEATHER: 
     Clear night. Windy. 

CHARGES: 

     3Z10E3L – MD TA 21-902(a) (1): Driving Vehicle Under Influence of Alcohol 
     3Z20E3L – MD TA 21-902(b) (1): Driving Vehicle While Impaired by Alcohol
     3Z30E3L – MD TA 21-201(a)(1): Driver Failure to Obey Properly Placed Traffic Control Device Instructions
     SERO S0E3L0XF – 55*: Headlights
    
     I request this case be CLOSED by arrest.

     All events occurred in Garrett County, Maryland.
